title: Lobby groups oppose gun reform after Bondi Beach attack | ABC NEWS
description: The Bondi attack has placed Australia's gun laws in the spotlight as federal and state governments enact a slew of reforms. Gun dealers and lobby groups are fighting back with coordinated online campaigns and petitions. They argue the changes will unfairly penalise law-abiding gun owners and hamper pest control. title: Government plans 2027 gas reservation scheme to push prices down | ABC NEWS
description: The government will implement a gas reservation scheme for the east coast, mandating that gas producers reserve 15 per cent of extracted gas for domestic use to help lower prices. Tony Wood from the Grattan Institute says the hope is the policy will bring down prices, but we must not lose sight of the need to reduce gas consumption by 2040 and 2050. title: Teen Bondi survivor recounts leaving cover to help others | ABC NEWS
description: Chaya Dadon was at Bondi when two gunmen started firing at participants at a Hannukah celebration.  Despite having found cover, the teenager chose to leave what was a relatively safe area to come to the rescue of other children at the scene.  "Not one inch of my body felt scared," she says. title: Push to hold US Attorney-General Pam Bondi in contempt over Epstein files | ABC NEWS
description: The US Department of Justice has defended the partial release of the Epstein files, saying it must act with caution to protect survivors of the late sex trafficker's abuse. Congressmen Ro Khanna and Thomas Massie say they are drafting documentation that would find US Attorney-General Pam Bondi in contempt for not releasing all of the files by a legal deadline. It comes after the DOJ retracted a number of files from the online Epstein database less than a day after they were posted. title: Retiree loses $84k on dream island home that was never built | ABC NEWS
description: 75-year-old Lorraine Hemley paid $84,000 to a construction company to build a house for her retirement on a block on Russell Island. title: Investors target high rental yields in booming Darwin housing market | ABC NEWS
description: New figures from property research firm Cotality show Darwin house prices rose 17 per cent this year - the strongest growth of any of the capital cities.  While it's good news for home owners, itâ€™s not so for first-home buyers hoping to get into the market, who've been facing fierce competition from interstate investors.  And analysts predict the price surge will continue at least into the middle of next year. Sam Parry has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: PM apologises to the Jewish community | ABC NEWS
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has apologised for the experience of Jewish Australians, eight days after two gunmen killed 15 people at a Jewish holiday festival at Bondi.  After a cabinet meeting that agreed to progress a package of legislative changes, Mr Albanese said he was "sorry" for what the Jewish community and Australia as a whole had experienced.  The comments were made at a news conference in Canberra, where Attorney-General Michelle Rowland also announced new laws targeting adults who sought to radicalise children.  The prime minister continued to resist calls for a royal commission into the attack, insisting he wanted "urgency and unity, not division and delay". title: Government plans to lower gas prices by reserving portion for domestic use | ABC NEWS
description: The Australian government has mandated that east coast gas producers reserve a portion of their output for domestic use to strengthen supply and lower prices. Energy Minister Chris Bowen announced plans to consult with the industry about reserving 15% to 25% of extracted gas. The scheme would start operating in 2027 but apply to any new contracts entered into from today. title: Bondi tribute collected for future permanent memorial | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 The sea of flowers and tribute items outside Bondi Pavilion have been cleared from the makeshift memorial, with plans to preserve many of them for historical purposes.  00:39 French engineer Dan Elkayam was among 15 people killed at Bondi Beach on December 14. Mourners at his funeral heard he was a passionate young man who felt strongly about his Jewish identity and playing soccer.  01:27 A vigil marking one week since the Bondi Beach terror attack has drawn thousands of people to remember the lives lost. title: Explosives were thrown by Bondi attackers, court documents show | ABC NEWS
description: Police allege that 24-year-old Naveed Akram and his father, Sajid, threw four improvised explosive devices at a Jewish Hanukkah event at Bondi Beach, but none detonated. In the weeks before the attack, they trained with firearms and recorded a video supporting Islamic State ideology. title: Tougher gun and protest laws for NSW likely to pass | ABC NEWS
description: Sweeping new laws are being debated in NSW as a response to the Bondi Beach attack. State parliament has been recalled before Christmas to introduce tougher restrictions on guns and protests. The bills are likely to pass as the Liberal party split with the Nationals to back the change. title: Hopes new Darwin-to-China flights will bring down domestic airfares | ABC NEWS
description: For the first time since the COVID pandemic, direct flights between Darwin and China have resumed. A development welcomed as a win for business and tourism in the Top End.  Over the past year the NT has also seen new routes added to Singapore and Malaysia, which officials say could help turn the territory's economic tides. Matt Garrick has this report for ABC News Northern Territory.
